result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey R. Peterson #345645 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing Hearing - August 24, 2015

CASES: 14CF346, 14CV362 Defendant Corey R. Peterson in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KJB- Clerk.  10:17am Def plea of G. Parties waive PSI. CT accepts plea, find G, enters JOC. 

SENTENCING:  12years in prison, 6 IC & 6 ES. concurrent to sentence in Chippewa County case no. 14CF262, 338 days sent credit, $290.60 fine/cost, orders seizure of money in 14CV362 in amount of $3428.00, elig for SAP, cannot possess firearms or body armor, cannot vote or hold public office, if not US Citizen could be deported, no sample but must pay $250 surcharge.  fine/cost & DNA surcharge to come out of seized money if possible. 10:33am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-24-2015 10:00 am
